title: Seeing double? Identical twin nurses help deliver identical twin girls at Georgia hospital
text:
CLOSE

Tara Drinkard and Tori Howard welcome the Williams girls. (Photo: Piedmont Athens Regional Medical Center)

Identical twin sisters working as nurses at the same Georgia hospital crossed paths in the most serendipitous way.

Tori Howard and Tara Drinkard, 26, together helped deliver twin sisters, Addison and Emma Williams, at the Piedmont Athens Regional Medical Center on Sept. 25 in Athens, Georgia.

Howard, a nurse at the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU), said in a statement she knew that morning when she got to work that she was going to be in the delivery room with the Williams family.

She didn’t know her sister was going to join her until right before the delivery.

Emma and Addison Williams (Photo: Sydney D. Walker via Piedmont Athens Regional Medical Center)

“We knew we’d cross paths in the delivery room eventually,” Howard said. “But we never imagined our first experience would be with twin girls.”

Drinkard, a nurse working at the labor and delivery unit, said she didn’t realize she was going to be in the delivery room with her sister until 10 minutes before the C-section was scheduled to take place.

“It was so special to be in the twins’ delivery with Tori,” she said in a statement. “We have always worked well together, even when we were little.”

Emma and Addison, born three minutes apart, required that there be two nurses to assist with the delivery, one nurse per baby.

Parents Brannan and Rebecca Williams told CNN they still have a relationship with the twin nurses and even ask their advice on how to raise their baby girls.

Rebecca and Brannan Williams get twin nurses' expert advice on raising their twin baby girls. (Photo: Piedmont Athens Regional Medical Center)

“[They] have become our friends,” Brannan Williams told the news outlet. “I look forward to letting the girls know about this one day, and hopefully they’ll get to meet them and keep carrying this thing on.”

The Piedmont Athens Regional Medical Center told USA TODAY the twin babies were discharged from the hospital Thursday.

Follow Adrianna Rodriguez on Twitter: @AdriannaUSAT.

Read or Share this story: https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/parenting/2019/10/17/georgia-hospital-identical-twin-nurses-deliver-identical-twin-babies/4008963002/
description: Emma and Addison Williams were born at the Piedmont Athens Regional Medical Center on Sept. 25 in Athens, Georgia.
